alert.note: Alert for Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS CENTRAL ONEIDA, SOUTHERN BANNOCK, AND SOUTHEASTERN POWER COUNTIES... At 258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Holbrook Summit, or 18 miles northwest of Malad, moving southeast at 15 MPH. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 MPH, half inch hail, torrential rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holbrook Summit, Daniels Reservoir and Holbrook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
